result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • David S Brinn was found guilty of OWI (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 43 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Department. Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

No use or possession of alcohol or drugs unless prescribed.  Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Perform Alcohol Assessment. 
Defendant to be involved in a 12 Step program 2 times a week with a mentor within 60 days. 
To attend the Victim Impact Panel Meeting while on Extended Supervision.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license. Take a Cognitive Thinking Course. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain/obtain full time employment. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

superTimeConds.notes: Defendant to perform 20 Hours of community service Each Year on supervision at alcohol treatment facilities.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant David S Brinn in court, in custody, with attorney Katie Beth Bricco.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern supervised by Attorney Susan Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Count 2 is dismissed by operation of law.

The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed Sentence of:
9 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 43 days )
- 4  Years of Initial Confinement
- 5 Years of Extended Supervision

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
- No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
- Take a Cognitive Thinking Course;
- Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
- Maintain/Obtain full time employment;
- Defendant to be involved in a 12 step program 2 times a week with a mentor within 60 days
- Perform 20 hours of community service each year on supervision at alcohol treatment facilities;
- Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge;

FINE:  $2531.00  
DNA Surcharge: $250.00
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to  Waukesha Police Department.

DL REVOCATION:  36 months.

IGNITITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel while on extended supervision.

Other:  AODA Assessment and follow through

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is  eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Hearing on March 28, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Paper copy filed with the Court February 26, 2014.

records.addlTxt: Defendant David S Brinn in court, in custody, with attorney Katie B Bricco.   Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for preliminary hearing.  Police Officer Katie Paulson sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Brejcha.  Cross examination by Atty. Bricco.  Testimony closed.  State moves for bind over.  Atty. Bricco objects.  Court finds probable cause.  Court binds defendant over for trial.  Bail remains as fixed.
Preliminary hearing on February 26, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
